Selected works by Chuan Ku and others

Microbiology Spectrum (2023)

Single-cell transcriptomics unveils xylem cell development and evolution

A single-cell view of development in xylem, the most abundant tissue on Earth, across divergent tree species, incl. Trochodendron, a vessel-less angiosperm native to Taiwan.

Chia-Chun Tung, Shang-Che Kuo, Chia-Ling Yang, Jhong-He Yu, Chia-En Huang, Pin-Chien Liou, Ying-Hsuan Sun, Peng Shuai, Jung-Chen Su, Chuan Ku, Ying-Chung Jimmy Lin

Tzu-Tong Kao, Tzu-Haw Wang, Chuan Ku

New Phytologist (2022)

Unraveling gene content variation across eukaryotic giant viruses based on network analyses and host associations

Gene sharing patterns across giant virus families often contradict with the core-gene phylogeny, but they can be partially explained by associations with different eukaryotic hosts

Tsu-Wang Sun, Chuan Ku

Viruses (2020)
